items.title: Top gainers & losers: Stocks that moved the most on August 26
items.description: Top gainers and losers today: Except FMCG, all other sectoral indices ended in the red with PSU Bank, metal, pharma, oil & gas, consumer durables, realty, telecom down 1-2%.

items.title: Taking Stock: Sensex sheds 850 points, Nifty down a percent near 24,700 as Trump tariffs weigh
items.description: Biggest Nifty losers were Shriram Finance, Sun Pharma, Tata Steel, Bajaj Finance, Trent, while gainers included Eicher Motors, HUL, Maruti Suzuki, Nestle India, ITC.

items.title: Derivatives traders unwind positions ahead of holiday-shortened expiry week
items.description: With a trading holiday on Wednesday and expiry of August series on Thursday, market participants are unwilling to carry aggressive bets, and instead, call writers, or those betting against an upside have turned aggressive, capping meaningful gains.

items.title: Sensex ends 850 pts lower, Nifty concedes 24,750 as bank, pharma stocks weight on sentiment
items.description: Laggards on the index included Shriram Finance, Sun Pharma, Tata Steel, Bajaj Finance, and Trent.

items.title: Live: Sensex slips over 650 pts, Nifty below 24,800 in truncated week | Closing Bell | 4K
items.description: Tariff Worries Hit Dalal Street. Trump's Additional Tariffs To Kick In Tomorrow. Sensex Slips 650 Pts, Nifty Below 24,800. Broader Markets Bleed; India Vix Up 2%. Sectors In Red Barring Auto, FMCG. GST Rationalisation Ignites Consumption. Nifty 50 Gainers: Eicher Motors, HUL, Maruti. Nify 50 Losers: Shriram Finance, Sun Pharma, Bajaj Finance. Catch Lovisha Darad and Yatin Mota as they discuss stocks on their radar.

items.title: Raymond Lifestyle, KPR Mills, Avanti Feeds, other textile and shrimp stocks decline up to 5% on US tariff worries
items.description: Textile, shrimp stocks declined on fears that orders could shift to rival exporters such as Bangladesh, China and Vietnam, which face lower tariffs.

items.title: TPG Asia exits Sai Life Sciences for Rs 2,675.6 cr, Authum Investment buys 6.2% stake in Veranda Learning
items.description: TPG had held 7.47 crore shares (38.83 percent stake) in Sai Life just before the IPO launch, of which it sold 2.3 crore shares via offer-for-sale in the IPO in December last year. Since then, gradually it offloaded the remaining 24.78 percent shares including today's share sale.
